problem: How many numbers are in the list $ -36, -29, -22, \ldots, 41, 48?$
solution: Add 1 to each member of the list to get $-35,-28,-21,\ldots,42,49$, and divide by 7 to get $-5$,$-4$,$-3$,$\ldots$, $6$,$7$.  Adding 6 to each number in the list gives the list $1,2,3,\ldots,12,13$, so there are $\boxed{13}$ numbers.
